content: equality hurts no one two mock up samples just for ideas… 1 here is one i made with a number of dk/baby weight yarns colors from my stash though the flecked background yarn is baby yarn from hobby lobby note i should have used a smaller hook…i used 3 75 and i think a 3 5 would have been a bit tighter mine is 50 x 63 and the image on the right is just a colorful mock up of some possible colors too 2 this is a customizable design i ve given you several components to work with repeat vary or omit as you choose you may even omit the main message/words and stick to repeating the patterns with symbols instead i have left this very open you can do scs or dcs between each design as much as you choose in my mockup i generally put 6-8 row here you can incorporate lots of colors to reflect various pride race gender and other symbolic colors here are some color palettes that you might find interesting to use for the in between spaces or in the actual design motifs themselves lgbtq+ pride lesbian flag ace flag transgender flag racial equality african pride and so forth there are no rules use colors you like colors from national flags gender colors seasonal colors…anything foundation chain should be 183 stiches plus 2 for border and 1 for chain turn if that s how you make foundations 3 gender symbols repeat 1-59 three times then finish up with remaining 60-65 4 disability and hearts first three stitches in row are non repeat 0 s then repeat 1-40 four times finishing with 41-60 5 neurodivergence / autism repeat 1-60 three times finish with 61-63 6 power / solidarity first three stitches in row are non repeat 0 s then repeat 1-52 three times finish with 53-76 7 equality hurts no one this is broken into 4 graphs d c b a full graph of this section is at end of packet
